summary: more than 30 000 cases of measles were reported in Europe from 2008 to 2011. in 2012, 8230 cases were reported to the european center for disease control and prevention. in 2013, outbreaks have been reported in Sweden, Denmark, Germany, Italy, the UK (England and Wales), Lithuania and the Netherlands. two days after starting the second cycle of chemotherapy, the patient experienced fever (38–39°C) with sore throat and conjunctivitis (day 1 of characteristic illness) no Koplik's spots were observed. a diagnosis of measles was considered and the patient was referred to the Infectious Diseases Unit. cultures of BAL were sterile; no respiratory viruses were detectable. MV was considered because MV was detected by PCR in BAL. the patient was ventilated in a prone position, received inhaled nitric oxide and required veno-venous extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) on day 22. the patient died from an unexplained hypotension associated with renal failure and severe metabolic acidosis. a patient with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and a patient with rhabdomyosarcoma died from pneumonia. all three HIV-infected patients were treated with ribavirin and/or immunoglobulins. the live-attenuated virus vaccine is contraindicated in immunocompromised patients. measles pneumonitis is frequently fatal in immunocompromised hosts. treatment should be tried as soon as possible.
